thread.title: Celebrate Carter's birthday with the greatest dunk
thread.title_full: Celebrate Carter's birthday with the greatest dunk

author: USA TODAY
title: Celebrate Carter's birthday with the greatest dunk
text:
Celebrate Carter's birthday with the greatest dunk And yes, there should be no doubt it's the greatest. Post to Facebook Celebrate Carter's birthday with the greatest dunk And yes, there should be no doubt it's the greatest.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/01/vince-carter-olympics-frederic-weis-dunk-greatest-dunk-happy-birthday-tbt-video/   Celebrate Carter's birthday with the greatest dunk Charles Curtis , USA TODAY 12:55 p.m. ET Jan. 26, 2017 
Vince Carter of the United States team (9) dunks over France's Frederic Weis as teammate Kevin Garnett (10) watches in the second half of their men's basketball preliminary game September 25, 2000 at the Olympics in Sydney. The United States beat France, 106-94. Carter happens to be wearing Nike Shox gym shoes. Handout photo from Nike. --- DATE TAKEN: recd 2000 No Byline Nike HO - handout ORG XMIT: PX33021 (Photo: XXX NIKE) 
Memphis Grizzlies forward Vince Carter turns 40 on Thursday, which seems just crazy considering how he's still playing at a pretty high level - just Wednesday night, he completed a sick 360-degree layup . Half man. All amazing. Legend.RT to wish @mrvincecarter15 a Happy 40th Birthday! üéÇüéÅ pic.twitter.com/G1LDTLMK9r ‚Äî Memphis Grizzlies (@memgrizz) January 26, 2017 
To celebrate his birthday, it's time to relive Carter's greatest feat: The Dunk. 
Now, it's not called The Dunk, but it should be. Flash back to the 2000 Olympics - Carter and the U.S. team faced France in the opening rounds. The forward stole a pass and took aim at posterizing 7-foot-2 center Frederic Weis (a 1999 15th-overall pick of the New York Knicks who never played a single NBA game) ‚Ä¶ and then this happened: 
That's right: He didn't just posterize Weis. He dunked over the center. 
Say what you will about Aaron Gordon's Slam Dunk entry last year or any of Carter's slams from his legendary 2000 Contest win. This is the greatest dunk in basketball history, mostly because it happened in-game, but also because, well, just watch the dunk again. He leaped over another human being who is 7-foot-2. 
Happy birthday to the guy who brought all of that Vinsanity with him. Read or Share this story: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/01/vince-carter-olympics-frederic-weis-dunk-greatest-dunk-happy-birthday-tbt-video/ Most Popular
